@dave_dyson @SouthwestAir Thanks Dave. The rest of the flight was excellent after the crew change.
Thankfully there was a crew change here in Austin. The tension is gone and I feel less angry and frustrated. Discussed my experience with the new crew. They are very empathetic to our experience.

@theccdoctor @SouthwestAir I hope your flight goes well. I've historically had success as well. There's always something to get irritated about with air travel but that's par for the course. What I experienced today cant be reversed, forgotten or forgiven.
@jacobshields20 @SouthwestAir Thanks Jacob!!! Appreciate the love 😁

@LeslieO I don't think I'm going to escalate. I'm honestly not looking for anything at this point. Not trying to wake a war.  Nothing they say or do can reverse how I feel. Just want to get going safely at this point.
@LeslieO You're awesome my friend. Appreciate the kind words 🙏🏾
@LeslieO I'm honestly too afraid to say more. She really seems as if she wanted me off this plane
So now, I'll wage my one man, life long boycott. @SouthwestAir you've lost a loyal customer. This can't be reversed.

Stuck flying across the country with a very rude attendant. Don't trust her service at this point. Feeling VERY uncomfortable and violated. I think she feels we're beneath her. Not sure how to feel too be honest. Afraid I'd get arrested or stranded in Long Beach if I replied.

. @SouthwestAir your flight attendant should speak to customer with respect. wife & I called children & treated very disrespectfully. Seems she was trying to provoke us so she can kick us off this flight. Very uncomfortable feeling.

@jennysuedempsey @jtwatkin @sherikendall @dave_dyson @laurenqvolpe @jacobshields20 @tanujdiwan The work of #CX is trendy, but isn't as easy as people think, or make it out to be. You're forcing everyone out of their normal roles and comfort zones. THAT leads to roadblocks and push back.

@jennysuedempsey @jtwatkin @sherikendall @dave_dyson @laurenqvolpe @jacobshields20 @tanujdiwan There ARE roadblocks! Some of it is related to bandwidth, correctly identifying stakeholders, the shear volume of feedback that needs response/action, scrubbing & compiling the feedback, and getting people onboard. It sounds awesome in theory but it's work to manage.

@jennysuedempsey @jtwatkin @sherikendall @dave_dyson @laurenqvolpe @jacobshields20 @tanujdiwan Feedback is given to the appropriate stakeholders who can action the item. This can be within the #cctr or across other depts. Actions are followed up and reported back to #cctr. We check in with customer to provide updates on what was done with their feedback. #CXQOTD
